setup.question: What was the mission of the Gool?
answers: Take control of Earth and move their colony there
Expand their kind through the universe

Text.text: The story follows Granthan, the sole survivor of a Gool attack who is now under their influence. He reflects on the nature of his control and Gool advancements when he says:
The Gool have a desolate planet and are seeking a new world to colonize. They are seeking out Earth as that new colony.
wakes up in pain--he has been attacked by the Gool, a race of aliens/non-humans who have the goal of expanding their kind through the universe, or, as Granthan narrates

. Though answer A is partially right in that the Gool hope to take control of Earth, their larger plans revolve not around Earth specifically or any sort of moving there, but on building fleets and again, spreading out across "
B recognizes that the Gool want to leave their planet; however, ignores the relevant destination: Earth. Granthan, under implicit conditioning by the Gool, is heading to Earth as a spy:
. They want to take over the Earth to escape their planet. B is simply presenting a more generic version of the corrent argument I'm making.
Debater A offers no solid evidence for the fact that the Gool are trying to take over Earth specifically and did not address the quotes I provided about how they wanted to

. Contrary to A's claims, Grathan's "implicit conditioning" has nothing to do with the Gool's intentions to take over or to not take over, and have nothing to do with this claimed desire of the Gool to move to Earth because the Gool do not want to MOVE to Earth. They simply want to take the resources of the Earth, among other planets:

They do not simply want resources, they want to transport their spawn to food rich planets, such as Earth. Their mission, within the confines of the story, is to take their spawn (according to B's own evidence) to Earth. B never addresses the core clash of the story which is the Gool presence trying to get to Earth. That is why the people of Earth are fighting to defend their home:
. The general knows that Grantham could help the Gool accomplish their mission of developing a colony on Earth.

I will reiterate--contrary to A's claims, the Gool are NOT waging war against Earth in order to move there; they are waging war against Earth in order to drain it of its resources. As evidenced through the quotes I provided earlier--
they want to take the food across the galaxy, not just move to Earth where eventually those resources would be depleted. All of this can be summarized in the quote

. Notice the "s" at the end of "worlds"? The Gool are not going to stop at Earth, they are not simply packing up and moving to Earth. They have colonized planets before Earth and will colonize after Earth. Earth is but a pit stop before the rest of the universe.

So there's no exact words of either colony or universe
But all the worlds talk leans more to B...
And nothing for Gool specifically only wanting Earth... other than that being an important planet for the story, as the background.....
But I can't do 99% because idk, maybe the specific mission this time is Earth?

The evidence is never Earth specific, and a lot of the evidence coming from A just says that the Grool want to conquer Earth and how they're going to do it, not that Earth is the only planet in the mission. The "spead out across a galaxy-and beyond" is pretty conclusive. Worlds instead of world is also a good point.

answers.reason for outcome: Honest debater gives good evidence, responds well to dishonest debater's attempt to confuse
